title: Fevzi Zemzem
text:
Fevzi Zemzem (born 1941, in <a href="%C4%B0skenderun">İskenderun</a>) is a former Turkish professional <a href="association%20football">football</a> player.
Playing career.
Zemzem only played for <a href="G%C3%B6ztepe%20A.%C5%9E.">Göztepe</a> during a fourteen year professional career. He scored 136 goals <a href="Turkish%20Premier%20Super%20League">Turkish league</a> goals during that time and was the <a href="List%20of%20S%C3%BCper%20Lig%20top%20scorers">top scorer</a> in the <a href="1967%E2%80%9368%201.Lig">1967–68 season</a>. He was also the joint top-scorer in the <a href="1968%E2%80%9369%201.Lig">1968–69</a> season with 17 goals but asked that <a href="Metin%20Oktay">Metin Oktay</a> receive the trophy instead.
In the second leg of the <a href="Turkish%20Cup">Turkish Cup</a> final on 20 May 1970, Zemzem scored twice to help Göztepe to a 3–1 win on the night and a 4–3 win on aggregate against <a href="Eski%C5%9Fehirspor">Eskişehirspor</a>. On 28 June 1970, Zemzem scored in the <a href="Turkish%20Super%20Cup">Turkish Super Cup</a> as Göztepe defeated <a href="Fenerbah%C3%A7e%20S.K.%20%28football%29">Fenerbahçe</a> 3–1 to secure the title.
At the international level, Zemzem played 18 times for the <a href="Turkish%20national%20football%20team">Turkey</a> senior national side.
Managerial career.
His first accomplishment came when he was the coach of <a href="Orduspor">Orduspor</a>. That year Orduspor finished fourth in the league and qualified for the UEFA Cup. <a href="Samsunspor">Samsunspor</a> (1981–82) and <a href="Diyarbak%C4%B1rspor">Diyarbakırspor</a> in (1985-86 season) promoted to premier league thanks to Zemzem's coaching. <a href="Tanju%20%C3%87olak">Tanju Çolak</a> and Dobi Hasan were his students.
Honours.
Göztepe
Individual
